title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-2.9 - Suspension and revocation of certificate
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-2.9 - Suspension and revocation of certificate

State Regulations

If the commissioner shall find good cause to believe that
the holder of a certificate of competence is incompetent or untrustworthy as a
boiler inspector, or has willfully made a false statement of a material fact in
an application or a report, he may by order enjoin the certificate holder from
further action as a boiler inspector pending a hearing. The order shall provide
for a hearing before the commissioner's representative at a reasonable time and
place and a copy thereof shall be served personally or by mail on the inspector
and such others as the commissioner may deem interested. Upon the evidence
produced at the hearing the commissioner shall order the injunction terminated
or the certificate suspended or revoked. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
4-2.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
